result.execSummary:
The defendant Dada Raseik Slocum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable Court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from Extended Supervision but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.

superMiscConds.notes: No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Credit for 413 days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to counts one and two.

records.addlTxt: Counts one and two.
Count five.

Defendant Dada Raseik Slocum in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Defendant Dada Raseik Slocum in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Eva Jefferson.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, with credit for 413 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS. 

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, with credit for 413 days time served, concurrent to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS. 

As to Count 5:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Counts 1 & 2.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges. Costs, fees and surcharges are to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letters in support of Dada Slocum, received and filed.

Defendant Dada Raseik Slocum in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Defendant Dada Raseik Slocum in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.    Pursuant to negotiations, Counts 3 & 4 are DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  The penalty enhancer in Count 3, of use of a dangerous weapon, is dismissed outright and not to be considered at sentencing.  As to Counts 1, 2 & 5:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
